items.sentence: How much did you have to pay Tom to do that for you?
Tom was three years old when his mother disappeared.
Tom began to worry that he'd never get his car back.
Tom said he and his wife went to Boston last summer.
Tom didn't have the money to hire a team of lawyers.
Tom wouldn't have done that if he hadn't been drunk.
Tom saw someone unloading wooden boxes from a truck.
Tom is looking for something, but I'm not sure what.
You might want to spend a little more time studying.
Tom participates in many extracurricular activities.
Tom finally mustered up the courage to talk to Mary.
Tom spends at least three hours a day riding horses.
Tom spends at least three hours a day in the saddle.
Tom has been looking for a job for three months now.
Tom isn't washing your car. He's washing Mary's car.
I'd rather stay home tonight than go to Tom's party.
Tom stood there for a moment without saying a thing.
Tom didn't tip the waitress as much as he should've.
You don't have to buy anything if you don't want to.
Both Tom and I came to Boston when we were children.
